content: The Google Nest Learning Thermostat is now the smartest part of my smart home, I love it.

Nest is a learning thermostat. You turn it up and down daily for a week, and it repeats it.
When I bought my current house it had Nest thermostats installed. The things were nothing but a pain.
I have had a Nest for a while and have had my internet/wifi fail a few times. It functions as a very basic thermostat.
Smart thermostats do the thinking you don't want to do, learning your schedule and turning down when nobody is home.
I love NEST thermostats. Besides their being a truly “smart” device.

I think Nest is dog shit. I've had it for 6 years and it hasn't innovated at all.

I've had two Nest thermostats. They were handy, but I won't use them again.

Nest is still horrible for old homes with individual thermostats controlling electric baseboards.
I am moving away from Google personally. I don’t trust them for privacy reasons.
I got a $150 rebate and upgraded to the Gen 4. It was a relatively cheap upgrade.
